intro: Randia mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbensis randia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. The fruit is a small, round berry that contains several seeds.
